meanings.definition: A baby born before 37 weeks of gestation.
meanings.sent1: The hospital had a special unit for preterms to receive extra care.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that preterms may need to stay in the neonatal intensive care unit.
meanings.sent3: The preterms in the nursery were so tiny, they looked like little dolls.
meanings.sent4: The love and attention given to preterms in the NICU helps them grow stronger every day.
meanings.sent5: The parents were overjoyed when they finally got to take their preterms home from the hospital.

meanings.definition: The period of time before a specified event or occurrence.
meanings.sent1: The preterms leading up to the big concert were filled with excitement and anticipation.
meanings.sent2: During the preterms of the holiday season, everyone was busy shopping for gifts.
meanings.sent3: The preterms before the surprise party made it hard for Sarah to keep the secret.
meanings.sent4: In the preterms of the storm, the sky darkened ominously.
meanings.sent5: The preterms before the wedding felt like a whirlwind of planning and preparation.
